name: 5-iodoindole
Reason: 5-iodoindole has a melting point influenced by its structural components. Starting with the basic unit of benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 °C, we have substantial structural components to consider. The iodine atom introduces a significant dipole, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +10 °C. The indole ring introduces pi-pi interactions and rigidity, estimated at around +20 °C. The methyl group reduces the melting point due to its small size and limited ability to participate in hydrogen bonding, estimated at around -5 °C.
